summary: in the 1970s, the first PEDV outbreak occurred in Europe (Wood, 1977) since 2010, a large-scale outbreak of PEDV has occurred in swine herds around China. since 2010, a large-scale outbreak of PEDV has occurred in swine herds around China. studies suggest that the PEDV non-S-INDEL strain has stronger pathogenicity compared to the PEDV S-INDEL strain. NF-B regulates expression of numerous components of the immune system. RNA viruses interact with pattern-recognition receptors (PRRs) the pathogenicity of JS-A in 5-day-old piglets was studied by clinical evaluation. we also studied the gene regulation of TLRs, RIG-I, and downstream signaling pathways in the intestinal mucosa of pigs newly infected with JS-A. after 2 h, the cells were maintained in DMEM containing 8 g/mL trypsin at 37°C in 5% CO2 until a cytopathic effect became visible. the virus was cloned and purified by plaque purification three times and tested by TCID50. total RNAs were extracted using TRIzol@ reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) total RNA was reverse transcribed into cDNA using reverse transcriptase (TaKaRa, Osaka, Japan) the whole genome of JS-A was sequenced using 25 pairs of primers previously reported in Table 1 by Chen. CCTTT 6609-6628 1,323 PP6R AAAGCTTAGTGCAAAGAAAG 7931-7912 1,408 PP7R TTTCAAAGGTTAAGAAATTCT 7861-7881 1,408 PP7R CTCACAGTGGGTTGTAT 9268-9248 PP8F CGTTATACACACCACCACCCACT 9244-9263 1,304 PP8R GGTAACAACAACACAA 1-21012 S-1F TAAGTTGCTAGTGCGTAAT 20572-20590 1,692 S-1R GTCAACACAGAAAGAACTA 22263-22245 S-2F TGAGTCATGAACAGCCAA 22003-22020 1,511 S-2R CTGGTTGCGCTGTAGAA 23513-23497 S-3F GCGTCTCATAGGTGGT 23491-23508 1,310 S-3R GTCCAAGAAACATCACTG 24801-23508 twelve 5-day-old piglets were purchased from a commercial pig farm. piglets were fed a mixture of liquid milk replacer and had free access to water. after 1 day of adaptation, piglets in the challenged group received 3 105 TCID50 PEDV JS-A orally. expressions of mRNA for TLRs, NF-B and FcRn on piglet intestinal mucosa were detected by RT-qPCR at 4 and 21 dpi. real-time polymerase chain reaction Viral RNA of PEDV was detected as previously described. TLR3-R TLR4-F AAGGCATCTGCTGGGATTT 74 AB078418.1 TLR4-R TLR7-F CCGTCAGTGTGTGTGGATTT 74 AB078418.1 TLR4-R TLR7-F CCGTCAGTATCAAGGTGGAAAG CCCAGGTCCTCTAC 77 DQ647699.2 TLR7-R TLR8-F CATTAAGAGGCAAG polystyrene 96-well microplates were coated with purified PEDV N diluted in PBS containing Tween-20 (PBST) the plates were blocked with 100 L 5% skimmed milk in PBST and incubated at 37°C for 1 h. after washing the plates, 100 L of serum samples per well was added and incubated at 37°C for 1 h. ID50 of JS-A virus was diluted in DMEM in a 50 L volume. the mixture was inoculated into Vero cells and incubated at 37°C for 1 h. the virus in the maintenance medium was incubated in a 37°C and 5% CO2 incubator for 2 days. after 2 h, cells were maintained in DMEM containing 8 g/mL trypsin. the supernatant was collected after the cytopathic effect was observed. the virus was cloned and purified by plaque purification three times. fected Vero cells were negatively stained with 2% sodium phosphotungstic acid (pH 6.8) and examined using a Hitachi Model H-7650 TEM (Hitachi H-7000FA, Japan) total RNAs were extracted using TRIzol@ reagent (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) total RNA was reverse transcribed into cDNA using reverse transcriptase (TaKaRa, Osaka, Japan) PP6F ATTGGTAATGTGATGCCTTT 6609-6628 1,323 PP6R AAAGCTTAGTGCAAAGAAAG 7931-7912 PP7F TTTCAAAGGTTAAGAAATTCT 7861-7881 1,408 PP7R CTCACAGTGGGTTGTAT 9268-9248 PP8F CGTTATACACACCACCACCCACT 9244-9263 1,304 PP8 GGTGGATGTT 19670-19689 1,362 PP16R GGCCCAATGTTTTTTTTATCG 21031-21012 S-1R GTCAACACAGAAAGAACTA 20572-20590 1,692 S-1R GTCAACACAGAGAACTA 22263-22245 S-2R CTGGTTGCGCTGTAGAA 22003-22020 1,511 S-2R CTGGTTGCGCTGTAGAA 23513-23497 S-3R GTCCTCTCATAGG twelve 5-day-old piglets were purchased from a commercial pig farm. piglets were fed a mixture of liquid milk replacer and had free access to water. after 1 day of adaptation, piglets in the challenged group received 3 105 TCID50 PEDV JS-A orally. expressions of mRNA for TLRs, NF-B and FcRn on piglet intestinal mucosa were detected by RT-qPCR at 4 and 21 dpi. real-time polymerase chain reaction Viral RNA of PEDV in piglet feces was detected as previously described. PEDV virus particles were round and showed obvious radial protrusion. the plaque-purified virus was titrated to 105.625 TCID50/mL. isolated strain JS-A was identified. phylogenetic analysis was performed using nucleotide sequences of complete genome (A) and S genes (B) of the PEDV strain from the GenBank database. JS-A is represented by a triangle. the severity of diarrhea was scored based on visual examination; 0 = normal and no diarrhea; 1 = mild and fluidic diarrhea; 2 = severe watery diarrhea; with scores of 1 or more considered diarrheic. the average body temperature changes in each group. PEDV IgG, IgA, and neutralizing antibodies were detected in infected piglets. the OD values of serum IgG and IgA in piglets inoculated with PEDV gradually increased at 7, 14, and 21 dpi. the antibody titer gradually increased and peaked at 21 dpi. piglets challenged with PEDV at 4 dpi. piglets stained jejunal (E) and ileal (F) tissue sections of negative control pigs. PEDV JS-A infection downregulated TLR3, TLR4, TLR7, and TLR9 expression. changes in FcRn, TLRs and its downstream-signaling molecules mRNA expression on intestinal mucosa of piglets induced by PEDV JS-A at 4 and 21 dpi. mRNA expressions of TRIF, MyD88A, MyD88B, IRF7, TRAF6, NF-kB1 (p105), NF-kB1 (p50), RelA (p65) at the intestinal mucosa from western blot analysis also detected N protein in PEDV-infected vero cells. PEDV virus particles were round and showed obvious radial protrusion. plaque-purified virus was titrated to 105.625 TCID50/mL. the GD-1 strain belongs to the non-S INDEL strain. it is currently a prevalent species compared to the classical strain CV777. phylogenetic analysis was performed using nucleotide sequences of the complete genome (A) and S genes. JS-A is pathogenic to newborn pigs. no deaths occurred during the study period. the OD values of serum IgG and IgA in piglets inoculated with PEDV gradually increased at 7, 14, and 21 dpi. antibody titer gradually increased and reached a peak at 21 dpi, as high 1:255. PEDV antigen was found in the cytoplasm of infected atrophic intestinal villous epithelial cells. no PEDV IHC antigen was found in uninfected piglets. the regulation of FcRn was closely related to regulation of NF-B. changes in FcRn, TLRs and its downstream-signaling molecules mRNA expression on intestinal mucosa of piglets induced by PEDV JS-A at 4 and 21 dpi. the isolated JS-A strain was more similar to the PEDV GD-1 strain. it was distant from classical strains such as CV777, DR13, and SM98. JS-A belongs to the non-S-INDEL, which is highly pathogenic. coronavirus HKU15 may be transmitted via the respiratory route, in addition to fecal–oral transmission. PEDV infection did not cause death of newborn piglets, despite drowsiness, anorexia, and watery diarrhea. PEDV has been reported to induce innate immune responses in vivo. however, few studies have been reported. vivo models were used to further observe the natural TLRs and signaling pathway homeostasis regulated by the gut microbiota. down-regulation of FcRn and pIgR has been shown in the tracheal mucosa of rhesus macaques. PEDV JS-A can down-regulate NF-B signaling pathway by inhibiting mRNA expression of TLR3, TLR4, TLR7, TLR8 at 4 dpi. data Availability Statement The datasets generated for this study can be found in the PEDV JS-A (GenBank: MH748550.1). Ethics Statement The animal study was reviewed and approved by the Scientific Ethic Committee of Huazhong Agricultural University. written informed consent was obtained from the owners for the participation of their animals in this study.
